g.text: Note that there are many ways the shell could implement pipes, and it's implementation may vary between shells.
The goal of this diagram is to show how pipes work in FreeBSD, using the shell as an example parent process.
to wait for process 1 to exit
to direct process 1 output to write side of pipe
to wait for process 2 to exit
to use read side of pipe as process 2 input
and outputting to stdout (default output fd)
